Text:
Thank you for this! Well seeded and great download speeds. I'm listening to Aguas de Amazonas as I type this and it's fantastic. I own a fair amount of Glass, and this is a great way of figuring out what I should buy next (and saves me the effort of ripping my CDs to MP3 for the iPod)

Thanks again.
Glad to help.

Some stupid problems - had to create a reseed: http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3591442/The_Philip_Glass_torrent_-_reseed

I'll seed that instead; hope it helps at all.
Yeah, if you enjoy the so called "minimalist" side of Glass, try some of the music of John Coolidge Adams: http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3595388/A_John_Adams_Collection

If you love Glass and the cello, check out these arrangements of some of his work done by the Cello Octet Conjunto Iberico. Pretty neat concept album:

http://thepiratebay.org/tor/3601924/Philip_Glass_-_Glass_Reflections_(Cello_Octet_Conjunto_Iberico)_
I've started downloading.  Amazing.  Thanks.  Only 10% down, but I've already been able to read some of your 'notes' - what an excellent idea to include these.  Thanks again.

Thank you for this magnanimous compilation of music by Philip Glass; if it wasn't for music like his and a torrent like this, it'd be unbearable for me to sit at my computer for hours on end writing code.

P.S. Dear Mr. Glass, I will re-pay you the debt of downloading this torrent soon enough. However, I have spent a significant sum on your albums as CDs, which were either lost, stolen, damaged, or altogether unplayable. This format is optimal for both preserving your work and ensuring your legacy as a composer. ;)
